text: In this video, we're going to show you
how to get better at Fortnite
by improving in a few key areas:
building, editing, and game IQ.
Use our clickable sections below
to keep track of what step you're on
during this tutorial.

Building allows players
to place down walls,
ramps, floors, and cones.
These can be used as defense mechanisms

or used to obtain high
ground against opponents.
Speed, precision, and accuracy
are all necessary skills to develop
in order to build at a higher level.
It is a great idea to spend a few minutes

practicing your builds
in a creative lobby.

During this creative
game, you should focus

on embedding muscle memory
into your play style
by repeating your building placements.
This warm-up routine is quite common
amongst professional Fortnite players,
including FaZe Sway, Mongraal, and Amir.
A common build sequence to practice
is placing yourself in a 1-by-1 box.

Start by establishing a
foundation beneath yourself
followed by four walls around you,
and, lastly, place a roofing from above.

1-by-1s can be used as a
defense against opponents.

After spending some time
working on muscle memory,
practice proper retakes.
This may be as simple as a ramp rush

or advanced as an umbrella
high ground retake.
Lastly, make sure to use keybinds
that you are comfortable with.
Keybinds refer to the buttons you press
in order for an action to follow.
They can make a drastic difference
in your building performance.

You should use default
builder pro settings
as a foundation to build off of.
Try different settings out
and see which clicks for you.

Editing allows you to
quickly create openings
in your builds, opening up opportunities

to take shots at players
and maneuver accordingly.
Similar to building, editing skills
are best developed through creative games.

You can find countless
editing courses to load into.

These will assist you in
making repetitive edits
and developing your speed overall.

And there are many
player-made edit courses
that can be found in the creative hub
for you to practice on.
After going through edit courses,

you should also spend time
familiarizing yourself
with all the possible edits in Fortnite.
Start by placing one of each build

and testing the game to
see which edits confirm
and which do not.

New players might find the
"CONFIRM EDIT ON RELEASE" setting

quite helpful, as you
can confirm your edits
without pressing a button.
Game sense or IQ is best developed
by playing competitive game modes,
such as arena or zones.
Over time, you'll begin to understand
how to make timely decisions.
Here are a few gameplay tips:

Never push a player who
has more health than you.
This puts you at an immediate disadvantage
against your opponents.
Make sure to always keep extra shields
in your inventory at all times.

These can be used during a
fight or immediately after
to prevent low health.

Third partying can also help
you pick up easy eliminations.

Third partying refers to
taking shots in the distance
at two players who are already fighting.
